item.label: Dura
item.name: Dura
item.description: The dura mater is the outermost and thickest collagenous layer of the three layers of meninges. Within the skull its 'outer' layer adheres tightly to the inside of the skull, constituting the periosteum. An 'inner' meningeal layer separates out as reflections between parts of the cerebral hemisphere, i.e. cerebral falx or between the cerebral hemispheres and posterior fossa, i.e. tentorium cerebelli. In the spinal dura mater there is a single layer separated from the vertebral periosteum by the epidural space.

item.label: Arachnoid
item.name: Arachnoid
item.description: The arachnoid is one of three meningeal layers associated with the brain and spinal cord. It is located between the dura mater and pia mater. The space between the arachnoid and pia is filled with cerebrospinal fluid and contains a trabecular network connecting the arachnoid with the pia.

item.label: Spinal nerves
item.name: Spinal nerves
item.description: The spinal nerve is a mixed sensory and motor nerve formed by the union of the dorsal and ventral roots, respectively, of a given spinal cord segment.
